result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raequan S May

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raequan S May appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Raequan S May.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Duerst. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Request for Prompt Disposition received 9/12/2022, filed.

Defendant Raequan S May not in court, in custody in Dodge Correctional.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Raequan S May.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defendant unable to be produced by Dodge due to scheduling. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Raequan S May not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Raequan S May in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Raequan S May in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Raequan S May appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
